data.name: Queens and Kings Stable Marriages
data.description:
So, there is this land ruled by `n` queens and `n` kings, all single, hetereosexual and - most importantly - unrelated to each other. There was a ball in which all the queens and kings met each other and mingled. Each queen made a list of all the kings, from the most desirable for marriage to the least, like the following: ``` Queen 0: [King 1, King 0, King 2] Queen 1: [King 2, King 1, King 0] Queen 2: [King 0, King 2, King 1] ``` Meaning Queen 0's favorite is King 1, second favorite is King 0, and least favorite is King 2. Every king did a similar list about all the queens: ``` King 0: [Queen 1, Queen 0, Queen 2] King 1: [Queen 2, Queen 1, Queen 0] King 2: [Queen 0, Queen 2, Queen 1] ``` Your task of course is to arrange marriages according to the preferences of your beloved queens and kings. But beware! Such marriage arrangement should be stable: infidelity seriously threatens the wellbeing of the land. A marriage between a `Queen i` and `King j` is stable if and only if: - There is not another marriage, say, between `Queen x` and `King y`. In which: - `Queen i` prefers `King y` than her current husband (`King j`), AND - `King y` prefers `Queen i` than her current wife (`Queen x`). - To paraphrase, there is not another mutually preferred match. In the previous example, the following arrangement of marriages is stable: ``` Queen 0 <-> King 1 Queen 1 <-> King 2 Queen 2 <-> King 0 ``` However the one below is not: ``` Queen 0 <-> King 2 Queen 1 <-> King 1 Queen 2 <-> King 0 ``` Since `Queen 0` prefers `King 0` than her husband, and in turn, `King 0` prefers her than his wife, they are very prone to cheat their spouses!

Input

You will get a `n x n` matrix of integers `queens`, encoding the list of preferences for each queen, and a similar matrix `kings` with the list of preferences for each king. On the previous example, you would get a couple of matrices like these: ``` int[][] queens = {{0,1,2}, {1,2,0}, {2,0,1}}; int[][] kings = {{0,1,2}, {1,2,0}, {2,0,1}}; ```

Output

An array of `n` integer with a stable arrangement of marriages. On the `i`-th position of the array should be the number of the king that should marry the `i`-th queen. ``` {1,2,0} ``` In case that more than one possible arrangement is stable, any solution will suffice.

Some hints

- A simple google search will give you some ideas about stable marriages, don't cheat though! - Be careful about your code efficiency
